title: Immigrant Workers And Bernard Kerik
body:
To the Editor:

 The situation involving Bernard B. Kerik is one more reminder of President Bush's decision-making process. First, 
go with a gut feeling; second, delegate the details to subordinates who will unquestioningly put the decision into 
effect; third, disown any fallout resulting from the decision. 

 Remember when the president said he had looked into the soul of Vladimir V. Putin, the Russian president, and 
had found a friend? Of course, such decisions pale when compared with the inspired decision to invade Iraq.

Robert D. Chagnon

Martinsburg, W. Va., Dec. 12, 2004

http://www.nytimes.com
